abstract: Longtime reporter and author Nina Burleigh appears to tread the line between journalist and advocate in her emphatic defense of Amanda Knox, an American exchange student who was freed by an Italian court after being convicted and serving four years in prison for killing of her roommate Meredith Kercher in Perugia, Italy, in 2007.
snippet: In the news frenzy surrounding an Italian court’s decision to free Amanda Knox, Nina Burleigh has seemed at times to tread a line between journalist and advocate.
lead_paragraph: In the news frenzy surrounding an Italian court’s decision to free Amanda Knox, Nina Burleigh has seemed at times to tread a line between journalist and advocate.

headline.main: Between Journalist and Advocate: The Amanda Knox Case
